verbs.description: impersonate (third-person singular simple present impersonates, present participle impersonating, simple past and past participle impersonated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To pretend to be (a different person); to assume the identity of.
examples: The conman managed to impersonate several executives.
Evil can and will always impersonate goodness.

entries.meaning: (transitive, computing) To operate with the permissions of a different user account.
(obsolete, transitive) To manifest in corporeal form; to personify.
